contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Christian leader | type = Bishop | name = Herfast | title = [[Bishop of Elmham]]<br />then [[Bishop of Thetford]] | image = | alt = | caption = | church = [[Roman Catholic Church]] | archdiocese = | diocese = | see = [[Diocese of Elmham]]<br />then [[Diocese of Thetford]] | term = 1070 – c. 1085 | predecessor = [[Æthelmær of Elmham|Æthelmær]], Bishop of Elmham | successor = [[William de Beaufeu]], Bishop of Thetford <!-- Orders --> | ordination = 1070 | ordinated_by = | consecration = | consecrated_by = | rank = <!-- Personal details --> | birth_date = | birth_place = | death_date = c. 1085 | death_place = | previous_post = }} '''Herfast''' (or '''Arfast''') (died 1085) was a medieval [[Lord Chancellor]] of England, [[Bishop of Elmham]] and [[Bishop of Thetford]]. ==Life== Born in [[Normandy]], he joined [[William the Conqueror]] during the [[Norman Conquest of England]], and was appointed head of the royal writing office after the [[Battle of Hastings]]. He was Lord Chancellor of England from 1068 to 1070.<ref name=Fryde81>{{cite book |author=Fryde, E. B. |coauthors=Greenway, D. E.; Porter, S.; Roy, I. |title=Handbook of British Chronology |edition=3rd |publisher=Cambridge University Press |location=Cambridge |year=1986 |isbn=0-521-56350-X |page=83}}</ref> After serving as Lord Chancellor, he was consecrated [[Bishop of Elmham]] in 1070, but about 27 May 1072 he moved the see to [[Thetford]], thus becoming [[Bishop of Thetford]].<ref name=Fryde217>Fryde, ibid., pp. 217 and 243.</ref> He had a conflict with the [[Bury St. Edmunds Abbey]], and when the case was brought forward, the [[Archbishop of Canterbury]] [[Lanfranc]] ruled against Herfast. He signed the [[Accord of Winchester]] in 1072 and died in 1084.<ref name=BHONorwich>{{cite book |last=Greenway |first=Diana E. |year=1971 |title=Fasti Ecclesiae Anglicanae 1066-1300 |url=http://www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=33866 |volume=volume 2: Monastic cathedrals (northern and southern provinces) |pages=55–58}}</ref> He was a married bishop, and his sons held land in Norfolk at the time of Domesday Book in 1086.<ref>{{cite book |author=Williams, Ann |title=The English and the Norman Conquest |publisher=Boydell Press |location=Ipswich |year=2000 |isbn=0-85115-708-4 |page=46}}</ref> ==See also== *[[Bishop of Dunwich]] *[[Bishop of Norwich]] *[[List of Lord Chancellors and Lord Keepers]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{succession box |title=[[Lord Chancellor]] |years=1068–1070 |before= first Norman Chancellor |after=[[Saint Osmund|Osmund]]}} {{s-rel}} {{succession box |title= [[Bishop of Elmham]] |years =1070–1075 |before= [[Æthelmær of Elmham|Æthelmær]] |after= see moved to [[Bishop of Thetford|Thetford]]}} {{succession box |title= [[Bishop of Thetford]] |years =1075 – c. 1085 |before= see moved from [[Bishop of Elmham|Elmham]] |after= [[William de Beaufeu]]}} {{s-end}} {{Bishops of Thetford}} {{Persondata |NAME=Herfast |ALTERNATIVE NAMES=Arfast |SHORT DESCRIPTION=Bishop of Elmham; Bishop of Thetford; Lord Chancellor of England |DATE OF BIRTH= |PLACE OF BIRTH= |DATE OF DEATH=circa 1085 |PLACE OF DEATH= }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Herfast}} [[Category:Lord Chancellors of England]] [[Category:Bishops of Elmham]] [[Category:Bishops of Thetford]] [[Category:11th-century Roman Catholic bishops]] [[Category:Anglo-Normans]] [[Category:Normans]] [[Category:1085 deaths]] [[Category:Year of birth unknown]] {{UK-bishop-stub}}
